column4: where can iI find release notes that are new to this version that weren't in 6.06?
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/EdgyReleaseNotes
the desktop CD is the liveCD, the alternate is just an installer.  Both the desktop and the alternate will install the full desktop, there's also the server CD, which installs a GUIless server
which download page?
ah.  Apparently... edubuntu calls it the installer, instead of alternate.
yes, you will be able to upgrade from the installer disks, In all the documentation you read it'll be referenced as "alternate" though
thanks for the help!
the upgrade wiki page mentions upgrading from the alternate CD, that'll be what you use, with apt-cdrom
no.  That 256 is memory required to install via liveCD (which is up from 192 in edgy), Alt CD still installs on stuff with tiny memories.
it says here that it is 256MB ... http://www.ubuntu.com/getubuntu/releasenotes/704
right.  That's for the liveCD installer.
where can I find requirements for standard install then?
everywhere still seems to say 256MB, but maybe I'm missing something
The alternate CD can install on stuff with lower memory.  How much memory do you have?
well I want to buy some used computers to give away with Ubuntu on them, I just need to know what the minimum I should be looking at is. I can get a 128MB 450Mhz PIII for $15.
you might look into installing Xubuntu instead of Ubuntu.
CarlFK, this will be to give to people that aren't used to linux too, so would like something eye catchy, so would prefer ubuntu to xubuntu.
Well, even thought the minimum isn't 256, with lower than 256, you probably won't be too happy with the performance.  And you won't be able to run the eyecandy
with all linux, there really aren't 'minimums' per sey.  You just get a sliding scale of responsiveness and stuff.
well, there are minimums, but the minimum is so astronomically low (and gives you crappy quality) that most people wouldnt have that issue
yeah I know this is the same with any OS, but still good to see suggested requirements nonetheless
yes
